definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)

sentences.english: I want to play table-tennis. Do you want to join me ? No, I'm doing exercises.
sentences.chinese: 我想打乒乓球。你想加入我吗？不，我正在做操。

sentences.english: They may also exercise in the gym .
sentences.chinese: 也可以在体育馆里做操。

sentences.english: Before doing morning exercises, I threw a bag into a lot of bags.
sentences.chinese: 做操之前，我把书包丢到放着一堆书包的地方。

sentences.english: Some of the boys did not exercise, really do not know how they think.
sentences.chinese: 一些男生没有做操，真不知道他们是怎么想的。

sentences.english: We benefit a lot from daily exercise.
sentences.chinese: 每天做操对我们很有益。

sentences.english: He gets up, exercises and goes to school.
sentences.chinese: 他起床，做操然后去上学。

sentences.english: Jim believes in fresh air and exercises for health.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆相信新鲜空气和做操对身体有益。

sentences.english: I want to play table tennis. Do you want to join me ? No, I'm doing exercise.
sentences.chinese: 我想打乒乓球。你想加入我吗？不，我正在做操。

sentences.english: Enjoy group activities and do exercise naturally and relax.
sentences.chinese: 做操放松自然，喜欢集体活动。

sentences.english: The community is important, and people identify with their own community, even if it means doing exercises in front of everybody.
sentences.chinese: 团队很重要，即使这仅仅意味着在别人面前做操。

sentences.english: Elephant:We do them on the fields.

definition: morning exercises (physical exercises commonly performed en masse at schools and workplaces in East Asian countries)
setting-up exercises during the break (between classes)
to run/to jog/(military) to march at the double
to drill/to exercise/to go outdoors for physical exercise
to do ensemble dancing/to dance in a group
to raise a flag/to hoist a flag
